result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell S Moegenburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with the business-Padways.

Defendant shall have contact with the co-defendant as authorized by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: All conditions of Count 1 are inclusive of Count 2.

Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to 2 counts of Misd. Theft-943.20(1)(a), Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 as amended and Count 2 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 as amended and Count 2 as amended and enters judgment.  Statements by the defendant.

Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth and Samuel Tufford appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel believes the offer will be accepted but was just communicated to the defendant.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with Padways Linden Inn or AF
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $2,000.00 signature bond.   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.   Adjourned to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
